page.title: 19HORTICULTURE
page.content: The well-known nursery of Rivers, founded by John Rivers in 1725, lies to the South of our area. The nursery was famous for the introduction of new varieties of plums and damsons. The firm has had a member of the Rivers family involved in it, without a break, for over 250 years. It is claimed to be the oldest fruit nursery in Britain. Peach trees were first planted there at about the time Nelson was fighting The Battle of Trafalgar. In the last two years the family have sold the property and it has been turned into a garden centre. Developers are hoping that houses will be built where once the fruit trees grew, although this land is within London's green belt.
